body.name: In Five Years: A Novel
body.description: A NEW YORK TIMES BESTSELLER A Good Morning America, FabFitFun, and Marie Claire Book Club Pick “In Five Years is as clever as it is moving, the rare read-in-one-sitting novel you won’t forget.” —Chloe Benjamin, New York Times bestselling author of The Immortalists ​Perfect for fans of Me Before You and One Day—a striking, powerful, and moving love story following an ambitious lawyer who experiences an astonishing vision that could change her life forever.Where do you see yourself in five years? Dannie Kohan lives her life by the numbers. She is nothing like her lifelong best friend—the wild, whimsical, believes-in-fate Bella. Her meticulous planning seems to have paid off after she nails the most important job interview of her career and accepts her boyfriend’s marriage proposal in one fell swoop, falling asleep completely content. But when she awakens, she’s suddenly in a different apartment, with a different ring on her finger, and beside a very different man. Dannie spends one hour exactly five years in the future before she wakes again in her own home on the brink of midnight—but it is one hour she cannot shake. In Five Years is an unforgettable love story, but it is not the one you’re expecting.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This is a book that doesn't mince adult words or feelings, and sometimes hits a bit below the belt when you aren't quite prepared.It's deep in higher education, lawyers, bankers, might class artists who make six+ figure incomes and the leading lady in this book is very busy climbing that corporate ladder. But she still has time for her best childhood friend, is madly confused about marriage to her long-time fiance, and working 14 hour days to become junior partner. Without spoilers, I will say, the story lands in some hard, sad places. That was edit ouch for me, because I've been there, and after 20 years, I still don't get the why's. But there is one more complicated, mysterious element to this book that will reel you in and keep you guessing. As cluttered as it may sound, it all works and comes together in a strange way that some of us will get. Others may not. Give yourself 5 years.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Interesting deja vous…
reviews.reviewText: A flash of a dream? Premonition? Dannie’s whole life is perfectly planned… until it isn’t. It’s a story about love and friendship; all the complications that can possibly happen when two friends grow up together, are fundamentally different, know everything about each other… better than they know themselves. Bittersweet book that offers a window into a complicated but incredible friendship between two very different women. I enjoyed it!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 25, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Introspection Amongst Tragedy
reviews.reviewText: At first glance, you think this is just another romantic novel, but it’s so much more than that. It’s about finding something to hang onto in the midst of tragedy. You ever see those flowers and plants that somehow sneak through the crack in a sidewalk? This is the book version. I don’t know if I can explain it.After Dannie’s dream, you think the worst. What actually happens is the worst, but in a different way. A completely unexpected way.The author has managed to sneak in some profound realizations along the way, and when those realizations are expressed, they are expressed in the most beautiful way. Many of those realizations left me in awe. The concepts are seemingly simple, but the author has a way with words that I can’t even explain.I’m not usually one to look this deep into a fictional book. But for some reason,it’s happened with this. The ending of this book feels like it’s left open to the present. It’s full of anticipation and not knowing, and being ok with not knowing. I will definitely be thinking about this book for a while and I’m sure I’ll read this multiple times.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Although the story is presented well. "In Five Years" spends too much time inside the main character, Danni's head. Living life within limiting boundaries only serves to hold her back, not set her free. I chose this book because it was an editor's choice, but it proved to be a hard study of the human psyche. What if, is not real, Ms. Serle.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 6, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Definitely a book you can't put down!
reviews.reviewText: Quick read you just want to keep reading. I'm not to the end,should have been but I ve been busy .Lol that I think of the book and want to to know how it ends! It's an easy read if your looking for a book that catches your attention and flows ,nothing dragging on and on. First time reading one of her books. I read by something that catches my attention in the description about something in my life and then sounds interesting twist on take on life. I'll read her again if something catches my attention. Good book to take to beach!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 31, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Friendships can be enduring
reviews.reviewText: You might see yourself when you read this book of choices and events that occur in life. You'll keep reading to find out how the story ends. The main characters are distinctly written and the chapters turn rapidly so you won't realize how fast five years pass. Friendships can be enduring as this story shows.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 1, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent Story Telling
reviews.reviewText: I couldn't put this book down, it drew me in from the very beginning! The way that it is written was in a style that I had not read before or if I did I did not remember.The book flows so well, getting to know the characters was easy; I even felt that I really knew them each personally! It's one of those novels where I'm going to have trouble finding another one to read tonight, tomorrow or maybe even 3 days from now.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars In Five Years- My Review
reviews.reviewText: This is the first book of Rebecca’s I have read and it did not disappoint. While I’m more like Bella than Dannie, both characters are likable and complete each other while being totally opposite.The ending leaves you wondering! It is a fast read.
Could hardly put it down loved the story line ! Author is fabulous will definitely look for other books written by her.
Un libro con un giro exelente, te sorprende el final. Vale la pena leerlo

Absolutely in love with this story and the characters. I was hooked from beginning to end, so much so that I had to put actual effort into going to sleep, unable to put the book down. The story comes full circle and the ending was perfect, in my opinion. I'm honestly so happy I found this book. Can't wait to read the sequel!Also, no problems regarding the delivery of the actual book for me, it came in perfect condition and arrived earlier than expected. :)

Ho acquistato questo libro per avere una lettura più leggera da fare in vacanza, tratta in inganno sia dalla copertina che dalla classificazione come romanzo rosa. Secondo me, questa è una storia che parla di amicizia femminile e di quel momento nella vita in cui gli amici si sostituiscono alla famiglia. Detto questo, l'ho amato moltissimo e l'ho trovato scorrevole e ben scritto. La storia mi ha appassionata e ci sono stati vari colpi di scena che non mi sarei aspettata. Mi aspettavo decisamente qualcosa di diverso quando l'ho acquistato ma, nonostante questo, non mi sono pentita affatto di averlo letto.

reviews.reviewTitle: The best romance I've ever read in almost 30 years!!!!
reviews.reviewText: The ending is completely unexpected !The story in itself is a beautiful and in my opinion a genuine life lesson.
